page.title: 01BERROW AND BIRTSMORTON
page.content: The general impression of the area is of grass and trees and a small scattered population. Mainly in Worcestershire, with a small S.W. area in Gloucestershire, the block lies E. of the S. end of the Malvern Hills. 9kms to the West is the Severn whither drainage flows, except that the Wyndbrook joins the Leadon and then the Severn further South. Woodlands clothe the Hills which rise to about 250ms; lower land is undulating agricultural, with some grassy commonland. Dwellings, some very old, some with large gardens, are scattered along minor roads, and there are many farms, mostly small. A strong sense of identity within parishes or villages is apparent despite their scattered nature. A major road, A438, runs from N.W. to S.E. and B4208 runs from N. to S. through the middle.
